headline.main: A Peek at the Secret English Farm Where Amazon Tests Its Drones

docs.abstract: Amazon is secretly testing delivery drones at remote undisclosed location north of London; company joins Google, Domino’s Pizza other firms conducting long-range drone testing outside of United States due to nation's ban on piloting unmanned aircraft beyond operator's line of sight; practice has raised local objections and drawn controversy.

headline.main: Google, Lagging Amazon, Races Across the Threshold Into the Home
headline.print_headline: Behind Amazon, Google Races  Across Thresholds Into Homes

docs.abstract: Google is expected to unveil Google Home, device similar to Amazon's Echo, that uses artificial intelligence to understand what users are saying and respond conversationally; device is expected to redeem Google's standing as leader in natural language processing after Amazon beat them in creating virtual assistant for home.

headline.main: U.S. Tech Giants Are Investing Billions to Keep Data in Europe
headline.print_headline: U.S. Tech Giants Investing to Keep Data in Europe

docs.abstract: Amazon, Google and Microsoft are expanding number of data centers in Europe to satisfy European Union privacy laws and protect information stored on servers there from requests by foreign governments; companies are also motivated by profit due to growing demand for cloud computing services in Europe, expected to reach $16.1 billion by end of decade.

headline.main: Google Curbs Expansion of Fiber Optic Network, Cutting Jobs
headline.print_headline: Google Curbs Growth of High-Speed Fiber Optic Network, Cutting Jobs

docs.abstract: Alphabet says it is curbing expansion of its high-speed fiber optic network and is cutting jobs in that unit, reinforcing company's shift towards wireless technologies and other less expensive options; Alphabet senior vice president Craig Barratt will step down as chief exec of Alphabet division Access, which was overseeing Google Fiber, but will stay on as adviser.

headline.main: A More Money-Conscious Alphabet Emerges

docs.abstract: Google's holding company Alphabet reports third-quarter revenue from its 'other bets,' assortment of fledgling businesses under its ownership, rose 40 percent to $197 million from year-ago figures.

headline.main: The Stakes Are Rising in Google’s Antitrust Fight With Europe
headline.print_headline: Stakes Are Rising in Google’s Antitrust Fight With Europe

docs.abstract: Google will soon submit official rebuttals to anti-trust charges brought against tech giant by European Union; analysts predict even if Google wins, amount of money and resources spent on fight will mostly likely lead to alteration of its business strategy.
